h3.a: Vacancy on the Rose Hill Historical Society Board - Applications Accepted

div.h4: Applications must be received by Monday, May 4, 2020

div.p: The Rose Hill Historical Society's tax revenue comes from those residents who live within the Rose Hill School District's boundaries.

Under this revenue umbrella the Historical Society Board structure will consist of 5 members: 4 of which are appointed by the School District and the 5th position is appointed by the other 4 Historical Society board members.
A vacancy exists by reason of expired term. Position #4 is a four-year term.

An application is available by "clicking here," or at the Schools Administrative Center at 104 N Rose Hill Road. Applications must be received by Monday, May 4, 2020 and may be returned to School Board Clerk Debra Crisler by email at dcrisler@usd394.com or dropped off at 104 North Rose Hill Road, Rose Hill, KS 67133 (please use the drop slot near the front door) during business hours M-F, 7:00 a.m. - 4:00 p.m.
Interested applicants may also call 776-3300 for more information.

District Education Plan: A parent survey was conducted, teachers will make weekly contact with students/parents, there has been a district-wide exchange of personal locker items and return of district property, and technology devices have been picked up. Grading will be based on completion of critical standards.
Support staff are available. If you or you child is having trouble understanding or completing class work . . .

a.aria-label: Read more about Here to Help

div.p:
This message is to communicate the most current information regarding how the Corona Virus will impact schools as we move forward.
At 4:25PM today {March 17th, 2020}, Governor Laura Kelly announced that Kansas schools will be required to close their campuses to students, for the remainder of the 2019/2020 school year. Permission for small group instruction may come later. This includes all practices and school . . .

a.aria-label: Read more about COVID-19 Virus Information

li.a: Twitter
Facebook

div.p:
At the April 2010 Board of Education meeting, the Rose Hill School Board approved a "Pay to Participate" proposal as part of the budget reduction efforts the district was forced to impose to adjust to the reduced State funding levels. The approved proposal includes a one time annual fee students would pay to participate on athletic teams at the high school and middle school and activity teams at the high school. Refunds are provided if the student is cut from the athletic/activity team and does not participate in any other extracurricular activity or moves out of the district prior to attending a practice date.
High School Students
$70/Year for athletic/activity teams
OR
$25/Year for Activity Teams (Debate, Forensics, BEST, Scholars Bowl)
Middle School Students
$30/Year for Athletic Teams
(A $150 maximum charge per family)

a.aria-label: Read more about Pay to Participate
